column30: This quote is taken from Nicola's story below. ""in the space of 8 days I went from being super fit and healthy, non smoker, non drinker extremely active to daily heart and lung pain which ranges from crushing pain to stabbing, and the most extreme fatigue I‚Äôve ever felt because I went against everything I believe in to stop people in society shunning and judging me. Please think again before you attack someone‚Äôs choices. If someone has vaccine hesitancy then don‚Äôt berate them.""
column34: Druthers News & Information
column35:
Nichola‚Äôs Story | Oct. 28 | ‚ÄúSo this is me yesterday at Alfred hospital after 8 days of feeling really crappy and having given in to the pressure of getting vaccinated. 

This is me having  an ecg on my heart, and waiting for a chest X-ray and Bloods to be taken and possible further screening of my lungs incase of possible bloodclots. 

I was vaccinated on a Monday and instantly felt awful. To say I felt drained is an understatement. By the Thursday and Friday my chest felt as though someone was sitting on it and I couldn‚Äôt even run in small stints with the dog, Friday night I had crushing pain in my chest and my left arm went numb. I decided to ride the pain out as I didn‚Äôt want to ‚Äúburden the healthcare system‚Äù but by Saturday and Sunday I was having stabbing pains in the centre of my chest every 2 minutes for hours. My back felt terrible too, right where my lungs sit and monday morning I woke up to stabbing, throbbing pains in my heart.

I finally decided to go to the hospital and whilst I sat there after I‚Äôd been triaged 10 people came in in the space of around 20 minutes and EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM had the exact same symptoms as me and all  had had doses of Pfizer. I could hear each conversation crystal clear so I‚Äôm just relaying what I heard. One guy had been in two weeks ago after his first jab and had been referred to a cardiologist and was back again with the same pains in his chest he was 20! 

Now let be clear, this is a vaccine I did not want. But having spent a massive chunk of my life savings just living during these 260 days of lockdown and being told I wouldn‚Äôt be able to work, be a part of society and just live without being bullied, segregated and discriminated against I caved. Now As I‚Äôm writing this I have stabbing pains in my heart and left side of my boob as well as the centre of my chest. I‚Äôm shaking with heart palpitations and feel exhausted. The doctor told me that I had had a reaction to the vaccine and many people have come in with the exact same symptoms as mine having had Pfizer but 98-99% were usually ok and that a lot of side effects are coming out as it is a ‚Äúnew vaccine in the very early stages‚Äù. I was sent home after extensive testing and told to rest and take Panadol. Today the pain has moved to the left side of my boob and mainly around my heart. I went for a walk in the fresh air today and felt totally drained after. Life right now is really quite difficult and I am quite scared! 

So in the space of 8 days I went from being super fit and healthy, non smoker, non drinker extremely active to daily heart and lung pain which ranges from crushing pain to stabbing, and the most extreme fatigue I‚Äôve ever felt because I went against everything I believe in to stop people in society shunning and judging me.

Please think again before you attack someone‚Äôs choices. If someone has vaccine hesitancy then don‚Äôt berate them. The risks of vaccine Injury are real and the numbers of adverse reactions are probably way higher than we know. All because you were ok after your jabs, doesn‚Äôt mean others will be! Let‚Äôs hope I feel better soon. But nobody can tell me that because there is not one shred of data to say how this ends for me!‚Äù

‚Äî‚Äî-

This is just one of an overwhelming amount of stories we hear just like this. Maybe it‚Äôs time to start questioning things more deeply! Like, why are the vax manufacturers relieved of all liability when their products cause injury or death?

column30: TINA-DESIREE BERG: Yeah, that‚Äôs right. That‚Äôs right. So, I think that‚Äôs a significant part of the story. So, City Hall is stationed exactly across the street from LAPD headquarters. And where this bully happened is in the sidewalk and the street area right in front of the headquarters. The police had been there all morning. When I got there, there was probably five or six cruisers lined up with officers in them. So they were absolutely present. And I don‚Äôt know what the delay was, as far as, you know, not responding to what was going on, but they did not initially respond. AMY GOODMAN: And then, track the people, some of the people that you saw there at this protest, along the coast, from California to Oregon to Washington. TINA-DESIREE BERG: Right. So, the main guide that you see coming out ‚Äî OK, so there‚Äôs Patino that came across the street, Benjamin Patino, and messed with the skateboarder kid and then went back. Then you see another one appear. His name is Adam Kiefer. He is actually part of a more violent group that I‚Äôve seen. And, in fact, related to this, I was covering another anti-vax protest in West Hollywood a couple of weeks ago, and Adam Kiefer came across the street towards me and two other journalists and started threatening us. I have some video of that, and in it, you‚Äôll see him say, ‚ÄúWhy are you throwing rocks at me?‚Äù ‚Äî and which nobody was doing. Obviously, none of us were throwing rocks. And I respond to Adam, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not throwing rocks. Nobody here is throwing rocks. We‚Äôre just journalists.‚Äù And then they ended up getting more aggressive. We ended up running into the Trader Joe‚Äôs and seeking refuge in there. They actually had to shut down the store for a few minutes, until they called the sheriff‚Äôs department to show up. But so, I‚Äôve seen him there. I have seen him in Huntington Beach as part of a group that‚Äôs been at the Huntington Beach rallies. Those were happening every week during the run-up to the general election. They were pro-Trump. He‚Äôs been in Beverly Hills assaulting people. They also had weekly rallies there at the Beverly Garland Park, which is right off of Wilshire Boulevard. So, I also have filmed him in Sacramento being violent, beating up people. So this is somebody that‚Äôs definitely traveled around. So, it‚Äôs interesting to me, though, that at this point, Amy, that these guys are very dedicated to what they‚Äôre doing. And I don‚Äôt know that if you had ask them five or six years ago if they were anti-vaccine, that they would respond with an affirmative. I think this is just one more cause that they‚Äôve picked up because they do see it as a violation of their freedoms. AMY GOODMAN: Tina, how does this whole protest movement dovetail with the recall Governor Newsom movement? TINA-DESIREE BERG: Yeah, that‚Äôs an excellent question. So, because this was ‚Äî they called this a ‚Äúfreedom rally,‚Äù and that was part of the equation, was that we‚Äôre going to also have candidates that are running for governor here that are against Newsom. So, recall Newsom is definitely gaining speed here in California. You know, Sarah Stephens, which is the candidate that I mentioned earlier, she was involved with another Proud Boy, Aaron Simmons, at this Wi Spa assault. She drove the getaway car. So she‚Äôs definitely tied with these guys. I was down in San Diego a couple of weeks ago trying to film a ‚Äî Mike Pompeo was here, and he was doing a rally for Larry Elder, who is actually tracking number one right now to win if Newsom is recalled. It was an event that was hosted by a Christian Zionist group. Jewish Voice for Peace and the Palestinian Youth Movement joined together to do a counterprotest and rally. So I went down to film that. I covered the speeches and part of the march. But when we got to where Mike Pompeo was speaking, where Larry Elder was speaking, there was a group that had set up some sort of a phony barricade in front of the street, so we couldn‚Äôt get further. And as you approached them, they were ‚Äî in much the same way you saw them menacing on Saturday, they were menacing us and egging people on ‚Äî ‚ÄúCome here‚Äù ‚Äî you know, very angry way. I researched some of those guys. There was one named Mike Forzano, who is also a Proud Boy. He is also a member of the American Guard, which is a designated hate group from the Southern Poverty Law Center. He was one of them. He bear-maced me. He hit me, hit my phone out of my hand. And I‚Äôm sure that there were others there that I didn‚Äôt see that traveled down from Orange County, what have you. But this is definitely a widespread thing here in California. And I think it‚Äôs probably shocking for a lot of folks outside of the state, because they see California as being a, you know, liberal, progressive state. But we do have an element of very hard-right folks here. And they do ‚Äî they have become much more vocal under the Trump administration. AMY GOODMAN: So, can you also tell us about what happened? column30: So, Novak. Mate. Don‚Äôt let the door hit you on the way out, hey? Novak Djokovic Got the Boot. Australians Are Thrilled. Jan. 15, 2022 Mark Baker/Associated Press By Van Badham Ms. Badham is an Australian journalist and the author of ‚ÄúQAnon and On: A Short and Shocking History of Internet Conspiracy Cults.‚Äù Update: A panel of judges ruled on Sunday that Australia‚Äôs immigration minister was within his rights to cancel the tennis champion Novak Djokovic‚Äôs visa. The judges‚Äô ruling is final; the Australian Open begins Monday. MELBOURNE, Australia ‚Äî Novak Djokovic has had his visa to stay in Australia revoked ‚Äî not once but twice. After a successful appeal of his apprehension at the border by authorities, our immigration minister has affirmed the initial refusal. The world‚Äôs No. 1 men‚Äôs singles tennis player is out of the Australian Open (at least for now). It‚Äôs a move that the local papers have claimed will ‚Äúundoubtedly prove popular with the Australian public.‚Äù So, Novak. Mate. Don‚Äôt let the door hit you on the way out, hey? Australians may well be exhausted from two years of the pandemic and sick and weakened by a current mass infection of Covid-19, and yet many of us retain enough energy to be thrilled by this news. The hashtag #DjokovicOut has been a trending topic here for days. A poll conducted by a local media organization reported a staggering 83 percent of 60,000 respondents were in favor of Djokovic‚Äôs booting. Two major network news anchors were caught on hot mics using at least 10 expletives to discuss the issue. This would usually provoke some social sanction, but given that the expletives in question were used to describe Djokovic, both news anchors have since become national heroes. And yet none of the acrimony is about tennis. It is entirely about Australia‚Äôs experience of the pandemic, the growing policy failures of Prime Minister Scott Morrison‚Äôs government and the current out-of-control spread of the Omicron variant here. Within this context, an otherwise skilled sportsman has made himself a cackhanded symbol of everything presently enraging Australians. His first mistake was to align himself with the kinds of ideas Australians see in online misinformation campaigns from the anti-vax movement. This is a man who once self-diagnosed a gluten intolerance by gripping some bread. He‚Äôs made claims that polluted water can be cleansed with the mind. He declared he was ‚Äúopposed to vaccination‚Äù back in April 2020, before a vaccine was even available for the coronavirus. Our social tolerance is also dwindling for those whose approach to public health is seen as selfish. (An extraordinary 90 percent of Australians are fully vaccinated.) Sports commentators reminded readers that when Naomi Osaka became unwell in 2021, Djokovic insisted that the press appearances she resisted were ‚Äúpart of the sport‚Äù ‚Äî yet he‚Äôs conducted his current Australian misadventure around his own preferences, not his obligations to society. Djokovic, a Serbian national, arrived in Melbourne on Jan. 5 to compete in the prestigious local Grand Slam event. He‚Äôs a legend of the tournament; he has won it a record nine times. A 10th victory at this year‚Äôs open would seal his sporting legacy as the winner of the most individual men‚Äôs Grand Slam titles in tennis history. Instead, he‚Äôll likely be deported. His coy refusal to ‚Äúbe forced by someone to take a vaccine‚Äù may have made Djokovic a poster boy for a marginal local movement of anti-vaccine extremists, but it‚Äôs brought him into sharp conflict with the majority of Australians‚Äô attitudes toward managing the virus. When the pandemic took hold in March 2020, Australia‚Äôs federal government shut international borders to control its spread ‚Äî but made no provision for the tens of thousands of stranded Aussies stuck overseas who wanted to come home. As Mr. Morrison dumped more pandemic management responsibilities onto the states, they enforced their own domestic borders. When these policies were combined with lockdowns, loved ones were separated for months at a time. Only when states reached 80 percent vaccination rates were border protections relaxed ‚Äî some as recently as only this week. The Morrison government‚Äôs failure to order enough vaccines for the population resulted in a rollout popularly referred to as a strollout. The process of social repair has been long and difficult. Editors‚Äô Picks 10 Insightful Tips From People Who Prove It‚Äôs Never Too Late Jan. 1, 2022 Cookies? Chips? Pizza? Here‚Äôs How to Own Your Cravings Jan. 10, 2022 A Fascinating Page-Turner Made From an Unlikely Subject: Federal Reserve Policy Jan. 16, 2022 On ‚ÄòS.N.L.,‚Äô Biden Urges Covid-Weary Nation to Stop Seeing ‚ÄòSpider-Man‚Äô Jan. 16, 2022 ‚ÄòI Was Not Whole‚Äô: Why a Grandfather Went Back to College Jan. 14, 2022 He Makes Tom Brady‚Äôs Offense Work Jan. 13, 2022 ‚ÄòThere‚Äôs Not Just One Type of Porn‚Äô: Erika Lust‚Äôs Alternative Vision Jan. 14, 2022 A Library the Internet Can‚Äôt Get Enough Of Jan. 15, 2022 Is Interning for (truncated)

column34: Stormont Vail Health
column35:
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ the sedative was given
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ the paralytic was given
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ the patient was intubated
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ their central line was placed
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ their arterial line was placed
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ their Vas Cath was placed
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ CRRT initiated
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ the patient was proned
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ the ABG was drawn
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ the family was notified
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ the zoom meeting was set for
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ the family said their goodbyes
‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ of death

That was someone‚Äôs mother, father, brother, sister, aunt, uncle, friend, spouse. 

That was their ‚Ä¢time‚Ä¢ to go. And I feel confident in saying the virus made it too soon.

I‚Äôve stood outside a patient room with clasped hands, giving a thumbs up to a patient through a window as they were being extubated. Moments before: 

‚ÄúStay calm. The respiratory therapist is going to take this breathing tube out, okay? I need you to nod your head so I know you understand me. I know, don‚Äôt try to talk. You‚Äôre doing great.‚Äù

I've taught patients to call when they were ready to be intubated. Days of being on the BiPAP on 100% oxygen can only be effective for so long. They get tired. 

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt breathe.‚Äù 

‚ÄúOkay, let me call the doctor and get everything ready.‚Äù

‚ÄúTell my kids I love them.‚Äù 

‚ÄúTell them yourself we are calling them before this happens.‚Äù 

‚ÄúPlease make sure I come off the ventilator.‚Äù

‚ÄúListen to me, you fight like heck, okay?‚Äù

‚ÄúHow am I supposed to fight when I‚Äôll be asleep?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou just have to go into this knowing you want to fight. You will never be alone. We will fight this with you.‚Äù

To: Nurses, Doctors, Nurse Practitioners, Respiratory Therapists, Pharmacists, CNAs, PCTs, Phlebotomists, Rad and CT techs, and anyone else I missed,

How many times do we go home holding on to any bit of hope that what we are doing is making a difference for these patients?

We‚Äôll spend 14 hours with hypoxia and hypotension, go home, and come back only to find out the patient didn‚Äôt make it.

All those times we felt like we weren‚Äôt doing anything for these patients - Your chance is here.

If you have even the SLIGHTEST bit of opportunity to prevent getting this virus and giving it to others - Take it.

Do it for the patients you lost. For some, you were the last person they talked to. The last hand they held.

‚Ä¢Time‚Ä¢ 1118
That‚Äôs the ‚Ä¢time‚Ä¢ I received the Covid-19 vaccine today.

Jenifer, RN
Stormont Vail Health

#wetogether
#mytime to make a difference
#mytime is for my patients

column34: Rep. Vitale
column35:
You Scared the Republicans So Much, You Forced Them to Write a New Vax Choice Bill in a Hurry. It PROVIDES NO MEDICAL FREEDOM.

Don‚Äôt Be Fooled.

Yesterday was quite a day with not one but TWO emails about a NEW bill that is going to be launched to ‚Äúprotect Ohioan‚Äôs freedom‚Äù except it does no such thing. Don‚Äôt let them fool you as they always try with their Kabuki theatre and decepticon language and actions. The already have a bill, but the truth is, HB 248 is a good bill with simply too much freedom.

Here‚Äôs my summary on this NEW DO-NOTHING BILL:

This NEW bill was drafted in just the past few days, (even though they tell you they have been working for months) for Covid vaccine legislation. This appears to be a sad excuse that the Republican House Leadership is putting forth to pacify Ohioans about the Covid Vax Mandates. 

The bill would prohibit (certain, not all) PUBLIC entities from mandating the Covid jab and does NOTHING for students, employees, etc. and nothing for all private citizens not working for some government agency. 

It also clarifies that this bill ONLY applies to the Covid vaccine. And the ""best"" part? This bill (unlike all the other big government bills that get passed all the time) has a SUNSET PROVISION in two years. Meaning, that the law would automatically expire and cease to exist two years after going into effect. It is so bad you'd literally think it was an April Fool's joke. This is a sad excuse for a so-called action to protect Ohioans. ""Your freedom is only good for 2 years and only if you work for or study at a public entity.""

This bill is a classic example of ""rules for thee and not for me"" as public and state employees would be exempt from the vax mandates, while everyday Ohioans would be left just where we started at the beginning of this mess. With no medical freedom.

I am disgusted by this last-minute effort by Republicans who talk out of both sides of their mouth. We already have a good, strong bill in HB 248 that‚Äôs been around for all to see for months. But because the big donors and lobbyists, who really call the shots and make MONEY on the shots, are pushing this piece of junk bill, it really protects no one from their untested, magic elixir. And will take FOREVER to pass.

The Republican Leadership, lobbyist and big money machine are hoping the other reps will ‚Äúget in line‚Äù and take their lead, as opposed to responding to the wishes and cries of the voters they represent. They are taking advantage of Ohioans' lack of knowledge of the legislative process and hoping this takes the heat off of all the phone calls you have been making. Isn‚Äôt that the point of an elected official, to LISTEN to the will of their district?

I hope this only adds fuel to you and all Ohioans' fires. Keep flooding your representative with calls for a real and substantial bill that will actually protect ALL Ohioans from being forced to put something in their bodies without consent or choice or be fined, discriminated against or jailed. That bill is HB 248 that they keep blocking.

It is appalling to me they would try to pull the wool over our eyes by putting forth a last minute bill claiming it will protect Ohioans when all it really protects is their own political class. They really do think they are above you and smarter than you.

KEEP CALLING and tell them SIGN THE DISCHARGE PETITION for HB248 and let‚Äôs have PUBLIC DEBATE about medical freedom. And we DON‚ÄôT WANT this FAKE NEW BILL written to attempt to take pressure off. KEEP THE PRESSURE ON.

IT‚ÄôS WORKING. I know for a fact you are making the reps and leadership very uncomfortable, and they do not like it. Just like they have moles, our side has moles too and I was directly told by an insider last night, they came up with this language, last minute to ‚Äòget the public off our backs.‚Äô No, their job is to LISTEN to the public who elected you, not the lobbyists and big donors and ignore the citizens' cries for freedom.

Make your voice heard!

CALL 614-466-4308 and they will connect you to your representative. OR
 
You can also go to:
 
https://www.legislature.ohio.gov/legislators/district-maps

Put in your zip code and put your rep on speed dial in your phone. Call them daily, twice a day, ask them for an update and tell they you want the rep to CALL YOU back. You called them, they represent YOU, they can at least pick up the phone. But you know they don‚Äôt want to. You can probably find them under their desk.

""I want government so small you can barely see it and so efficient you barely have to pay for it."" - Nino Vitale

To read the email and links to the bill and summary, click here. I created a shared folder, so you have all the information. They always make things incredibly hard to look up. I don‚Äôt. I want you to see the truth for yourself. I trust you.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1_8uDR5B4HkwB8_AfIzUqWSssRELN1oaJ?usp=sharing

#SignThePetition

Please read all of this: Here's what we must ALL insist this Assembly accomplish... ...and IF they fall short, hold every single one to account. Political egos and personal comfort of these men and women count for nothing at a time like this. If they can't stand the heat, they can take a piece of paper and a pen and resign from political leadership immediately. It is an election year. The weak can be easily replaced with better men and women. Now for the substance: ‚Ä™The Tennessee Assembly MUST PASS CLEAR LEGISLATION protecting ALL people in TN FROM BEING REQUIRED under any circumstances, by any entities, public or private, to wear COVID-related PPE &/or receive the current COVID vaxs, or any future variant of the COVID vaxs, under penalty of law. The penalties must be stiff and on a per-incident basis. Note - These same Assemblymen AND this Governor enacted LEGISLATION last spring protecting themselves and all government employees at any level from being required to take the COVID vax, ever. Ask them: ‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt you protect ALL Tennesseans back then?‚Äù And wait for the excuses to flow. Write it, vote it, get it DONE. EASY‚Ä¨. This to include all out of pocket expenses, deductibles, copays, and cash payments made by those who suffered from such vax-related complications. The Assembly must also make law guaranteeing immediate compensation of any next of kin of any Tennessean who died of complications from the vaccine, if required by an employer, in the amount of $350,000 per incident for such death occurring within 365 days of having received a COVID vax, effective from the date such employer made vaccinations mandatory. A little harder, Write it, vote it, get it DONE. EASY‚Ä¨. Legislation must be passed requiring all employers who have terminated employees, or set deadlines for employees to receive the COVID vaccination or be terminated, to provide compensation to former employees, whether they were terminated or chose to resign over receiving the COVID vaccination as a condition of employment, a severance compensation equal to the sum of all wages, tips, salary, and other compensation the employee received in the 365 days preceding the employee's last paid day of work. Such amounts to be paid in equal installments over the next twelve months, beginning January 1, 2022. Write it, vote on it, get it DONE. Easy. I leave for the reader, and perchance a Crazymotherf@cker who happens to come across this post, the reasons why we need to not only to take the Covid-19 vaccine, but a Flu Shot is necessary as well. Thinkers all know that we are presently in all out war with the enemy the Deadly Coronavirus. A plague that has ruined 2020, and that causes an upper respiratory infection caused by some dumbass in China that ate a bat ,and got sick and infected everyone else. The reason to take the COVID-19 vaccine is for the purpose of stopping the pandemic, and it requires using all the tools available. Vaccines work with your immune system so your body will be ready to fight the virus if you are exposed. Other steps, like wearing masks and social distancing, help reduce your chance of being exposed to the virus or spreading it to others. Together, COVID-19 vaccination, and following CDC's recommendations to protect yourself and others, will offer the best protection from COVID-19 Not only is the COVID-19 vaccine necessary to take, so is the Flu Shot. Getting a flu shot this year is particularly important because, like SARS-CoV-2, influenza is a respiratory virus, and we want to do everything we can to minimize having two respiratory outbreaks circulating simultaneously in our population. We THINKERS understand scientific facts and not a bunch of bulls#it. Get wise Crazy Motherfu@ckers, if for no other reason your children's lives depend on it. CRAZYMOTHERS DON'T LIKE TO BE CALLED ANTI-VAXXERS A group of people opposed to vaccinations has requested that media stop referring to them as ""anti-vax."" Instead, they would prefer to be called ""vaccine risk aware."" On Dec. 1, an anti-vaccine group called the Crazymothers raised its plea on Twitter and Instagram, asserting that the term anti-vaxxer is ""derogatory, inflammatory, and marginalizes both women and their experiences."" In response, many social media users chimed in with their own alternative labels for the group, including ""plague enthusiasts,"" ""polio fanciers,"" ""pro-disease"" and ""patient zero."" WHO ARE THE CRAZYMOTHERS??? Founded in 2018, the Crazymothers have just over 1,000 followers on Twitter and about 18,000 on Instagram. The group recently hosted an event in Washington to ""raise awareness to the current epidemic of chronic health conditions, injuries and death from vaccination."" Nearly 3,000 people attended, according to a Crazymothers Instagram post. The group sells merchandise and offers ""expert"" advice on its website. The T-shirts depict anti-vaccine moms as superheroes, and these ""experts"" raise concerns about specific ingredients found in vaccines and the methods by which vaccines are produced. The efforts of groups like this are a problem, because getting vaccinated doesn't just help the person stuck with the needle; it also protects infants and many people with weak immune systems who cannot be vaccinated at all. Vaccines ensure that fewer cases of the disease occur, and therefore, those without the means to defend themselves are more likely to stay safe and healthy. Anti-vaccine groups like the Crazymothers aim to make vaccination optional, which would place these vulnerable populations at risk, according to the APP. The Crazymothers may prefer the term ""vaccine risk aware,"" but in reality, unvaccinated children face far greater health risks than those who do get vaccinated. Meanwhile, the vulnerability to disease of unvaccinated kids places others at risk. The fewer people who get vaccinated, the more people will contract perfectly preventable diseases.

column30: From ‚ÄòKu Kluxism‚Äô to Trumpism Sept. 5, 2021 By Charles M. Blow Opinion Columnist One hundred years ago this week, The New York World began to publish a 21-part explosive expos√© on the inner workings of the Ku Klux Klan. It was a sensation. At least 18 other newspapers across the country ran The World‚Äôs bombshell reporting. According to The Columbia Journalism Review, ‚ÄúThe series drew two million readers nationwide. New Yorkers stood in line for copies. And the Justice Department and several congressmen promised to investigate the group.‚Äù The World would win a Pulitzer Prize for its efforts. But, as I read through that coverage to write this column, I was struck by just how resilient Klan ideology has been in the years since The World exposed the group‚Äôs systems and rituals; its ideas have been repackaged and dressed up ‚Äî or, disrobed, as it were ‚Äî but the core tenets remain the same. I was even struck by how many of the same tactics are still being used to preserve white supremacy and subjugate racial, ethnic and religious minorities in this country. It proves to me that Klan thinking is not really about the organization itself or its tactics ‚Äî the night riding or cross burning ‚Äî but about the very meaning of America and who controls it. As one of the Klan‚Äôs ‚Äúgrand goblins‚Äù put it in a 1921 speech: ‚ÄúAmerica for real Americans! Guardianship against the alien, the anarchist and all who would subvert that banner, be they white or black or yellow!‚Äù It is that widening of the scope of hatred and oppression that first jolted me as I studied the Klan‚Äôs history. By the early 1920s, its leaders had moved on from primarily anti-Black hatred. To grow the brand, they had to grow the ring of bias. As one of The World‚Äôs articles put it, ‚ÄúNow the negro has become a side issue with it. Today it is primarily anti-Jew, anti-Catholic, anti-alien, and it is spreading more than twice as fast through the North and West as it is growing in the South.‚Äù That is not dissimilar from today, when xenophobia and Islamophobia have taken a more prominent role. In fact, The World wrote that at times the Klan would tailor its message of hate by region, appealing to Japanophobes on the Pacific Coast, framing itself as a bulwark against radicalism in the ‚ÄúCentral West,‚Äù fanning hatred of immigrants on the Atlantic Coast and stoking fears about Jews and Catholics throughout the country. As The World put it, ‚ÄúWherever a prospective member lives, he has been promised that his pet aversion will be made an object of Klan action.‚Äù This sounds eerily similar to the successful campaign that Donald Trump ran in 2016. Many of his supporters view America not as a grand idea, malleable and expandable, but as a white man‚Äôs invention in which the displacement and slaughter of Native people and the enslavement of Africans was a necessary evil. So they demand a strict deference to that idea of America because, to them, it promises a society bowing at their feet, a nation defined by its reverence for whiteness. At one of the Klan‚Äôs initiations, members were told to say, ‚ÄúAll men in America must honor that flag ‚Äî if we must make them honor it on their knees!‚Äù Anyone else remember how Trump supporters treated Colin Kaepernick? Furthermore, the Klan realized, much as Trump did, that hate was an industry and that the right ‚Äî or wrong ‚Äî man could milk it for profit. As The World wrote at the time: The original Knights of the Ku Klux Klan, Inc., modestly begun five years ago, has become a vast enterprise, doing a thriving business in the systematic sale of race hatred, religious bigotry and ‚Äú100 percent‚Äù anti-Americanism. Perhaps the last lesson and similarity between the Klan of the 1920s and Trump‚Äôs legion of supporters are that exposure doesn‚Äôt necessarily lead to eradication. After The World‚Äôs expos√©, the Klan didn‚Äôt shrink; its membership surged. Just four years later, in 1925, anywhere between 30,000 and 50,000 Klan members marched down Pennsylvania Avenue in D.C., in what The Washington Post called at the time ‚Äúone of the greatest demonstrations this city has ever known.‚Äù In 1913, eight years before The World‚Äôs articles, Louis D. Brandeis, soon to be nominated as a Supreme Court justice, wrote a piece in Harper‚Äôs Weekly under the headline ‚ÄúWhat Publicity Can Do,‚Äù arguing that ‚Äúsunlight is said to be the best of disinfectants.‚Äù But in journalism, this idiom is more complicated. Sometimes, the infected court the infection. Sometimes, the light you shine on evil also illuminates the path to it. Sometimes, publicity is advertising. Consider how this continues to manifest today. Over the past few years, we‚Äôve seen how the press has amplified all manner of conservative fictions and fever dreams, from election denial to the rise of QAnon conspiracy theories to the lunacy of the anti-vax movement. Sometimes people are drawn to these, and what we believe to be fact and logic repels them. Sometimes when we expose evil, we create or amplify its allure. (truncated)

column30: WHY WOULD THEY WISH TO WAIT UNTIL THE VAST MAJORITY OF THE RECIPIENTS OF THE VACCINE ARE ALREADY DEAD BEFORE THEY RELEASE THE DATA??? THEY NEED THIS MUCH TIME TO ‚ÄúHIDE‚Äù THE DETAILS? And yet they still DEMAND that we simply ""trust the science"", when they give us no reason nor ability to do so when they are clearly hiding the ""facts"" (not to mention their track record of constantly changing their narrative with respect to the effectiveness of the vaccine - remember when they first told us that once you got vaccinated you could no longer get nor transmit the virus?). I am not ‚Äúanti-vax‚Äù per se, however what has been admitted even by those on the left who have been pushing so hard to MANDATE it on the entire population (the same people who less than a year ago, before the election, were all saying that they would not trust the vaccine and would advise everyone NOT to get it), is that of those getting sick now, just as many are vaccinated as are unvaccinated. AND 90% OF THOSE HOSPITALIZED WITH THE VIRUS ARE VACCINATED. Even Fauci admitted this. They have a real narrative issue, as just weeks ago they were suggesting that the only people getting sick were unvaccinated, and then one week later they were forced to change their narrative when they told everyone - vaccinated or not - that they had to wear masks again as now (with Delta) even the vaccinated are able to contract and spread the virus - 180 degree turn from one week prior. Both narratives can not be true, however what they have done is rationalized a general distrust of them and those who are so aggressively promoting the vaccine (even to the point of actions quite reminiscent of nazi germany). The other issue I have with it - and this has ZERO to do with politics - is that, not only do they keep changing their story with respect to efficacy, etc., but the fact is that there is not one person on this planet who has had the vaccine for a year yet. Noone - regardless as to how much education and experience they have in the medicine - can tell you the long-term effects (which could be significant) as this vaccine was rushed through the FDA ‚Äì even FDA panelists admitted this (it technically hasn't even been approved - rather only for emergency purposes, but it has yet to receive actual full FDA approval). I have heard it all before - that the core components of the vaccine have been around for a while, however if it were that simple, then not only would the vaccine have been released much sooner, but it would have also been fully approved by the FDA. However clearly that is not the case, whether it be additional components in the vaccine, or the manner in which the components are mixed, or whatever. AND NOW THE FDA IS GOING TO COURT TO MAKE IT SUCH THAT THEY DON'T RELEASE THEIR FINDINGS ABOUT THE VACCINE TO THE PUBLIC FOR 75 YEARS. Bottom line is that there is a reason why it took as long as it did to come out, why it still has not been fully approved by the FDA (and now I understand that Biden, Fauci and the dems are ""applying pressure"" on the FDA to approve it now, so there goes any credibility given that it has now been politicized). And people have in fact died from the vaccine (not to mention those who took the vaccine but still got sick). Other vaccines (flu, polio, etc.) took years before they were approved for use, as the long-term effects needed to be known. That was not the case here. Bottom line - all ""conspiracy theories"" aside - noone knows the long-term effects of the vaccine (and as an additional factoid, while it is true that incidences of the virus (in both vaccinated and unvaccinated people) are in fact up, as are hospitalizations in some areas, deaths are not ‚Äì and at the end of the day that is the rationale as to whether or not all of our lives should be massively disrupted (or worse). Finally, clearly Biden, Fauci and the rest of the dems don‚Äôt really care about us, or even believe in the ‚Äúscience‚Äù, as if they did the borders would be locked closed and no one would be allowed over the border ‚Äì legally or illegally ‚Äì as was the case during the last administration. It is no coincidence that there is a surge in the virus six months after Biden opened the borders, let millions in illegally (75% of whom actually had the virus), didn‚Äôt bother treating or quarantining them, and then sent them on busses and planes disseminating them throughout the country. And they needed something on which to blame it other than this obvious superspreader event caused by Biden and the dems in which he allows millions in with the virus ‚Äì so they blame it on those who are unvaccinated and the ‚ÄúDelta variant‚Äù, when there isn‚Äôt even a test specifically for the Delta variant. So how could they possibly know that that is it? That is nothing more than speculation and deflection from the real cause of the spread. This is why our current ‚Äúleadership‚Äù must go as soon as humanly possible.

TRUMP 2021: ""February: 'Everybody, go get your shot‚Äù Speaking at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC), Trump said, ‚ÄúWe took care of a lot of people ‚Äî including, I guess, on December 21st, we took care of Joe Biden, because he got his shot, he got his vaccine. ‚Ä¶ It shows you how unpainful that vaccine shot is.‚Äù Trump added: ‚ÄúSo everybody, go get your shot.‚Äù **MARCH: ‚ÄòI WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO‚Äô MY VACCINE-SKEPTIC ALLIES** In a Fox News interview, Trump said, ‚ÄúI would recommend it to a lot of people that don‚Äôt want to get it and a lot of those people voted for me, frankly.‚Äù He also repudiated claims that the vaccines aren‚Äôt safe: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a great vaccine, it‚Äôs a safe vaccine, and it‚Äôs something that works.‚Äù **MID-APRIL: DEFENDED SAFETY OF JOHNSON & JOHNSON VACCINE** After the federal government paused its authorization of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine, in light of rare blood-clotting issue which vaccine skeptics seized upon, Trump excoriated the decision and pointed to the minimal adverse effects. ‚ÄúThe federal pause on the J&J shot makes no sense,‚Äù Trump said, adding: ‚ÄúJust six people out of the nearly 7 million who‚Äôve gotten the Johnson & Johnson vaccine reported blood clots.‚Äù Trump even suggested that the move would feed the kind of anti-vaccine skepticism that was on the rise in his base. (Allies such as Tucker Carlson have often pointed to unverified reports in the Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System, or VAERS.) ‚ÄúIndeed, this moronic move is a gift to the anti-vax movement,‚Äù Trump said. ‚ÄúThe science bureaucrats are fueling that deranged pseudoscience.‚Äù **LATE APRIL: ‚ÄòTHE VACCINE IS A GREAT THING, AND PEOPLE SHOULD TAKE ADVANTAGE OF IT‚Äô** Trump told the New York Post: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm all in favor of the vaccine. It‚Äôs one of the great achievements, a true miracle, and not only for the United States. We‚Äôre saving tens of millions of lives throughout the world. We‚Äôre saving entire countries.‚Äù Trump added that, ‚ÄúThe vaccine is a great thing, and people should take advantage of it,‚Äù while adding that it shouldn‚Äôt be mandated. **JULY: ‚ÄòI RECOMMEND YOU TAKE IT‚Äô** At a rally in Arizona, Trump said, ‚ÄúI recommend you take it, but I also believe in your freedoms 100 percent.‚Äù **MID-AUGUST: ‚ÄòONCE YOU GET THE VACCINE, YOU GET BETTER‚Äô** In the same interview in which Fox Business host Maria Bartiromo ultimately goaded Trump into initially questioning the boosters, Trump began by offering one of his most forceful pro-vaccine statements. ‚ÄúNow one thing: When you have the vaccine, people that do [get infected] ‚Äî and it‚Äôs a very small number relatively, but people that do get it ‚Äî get better much quicker,‚Äù Trump said. ‚ÄúAnd it‚Äôs very important to know. They don‚Äôt get nearly as sick, and they get better. [Sen.] Lindsey Graham is an example. He said, if I didn‚Äôt have this vaccine, I would have died.‚Äù ‚ÄúSo once you get the vaccine, you get better,‚Äù Trump added. **LATE AUGUST: ‚ÄòTAKE THE VACCINES. ‚Ä¶ IT IS WORKING.‚Äô** At a rally in Alabama shortly after the Bartiromo interview, Trump again broadly promoted vaccines ‚Äî even playing off those who booed him for it. ‚ÄúI recommend take the vaccines,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs good. I did it. Take the vaccines.‚Äù As some in the crowd jeered, Trump took care to qualify his remarks by noting that this is about personal choice. But then he re-upped the message. ‚ÄúYou got ‚Äî no, that‚Äôs okay. That‚Äôs all right. You got your freedoms. But I happened to take the vaccine,‚Äù Trump said, before defusing the situation with a joke: ‚ÄúIf it doesn‚Äôt work, you‚Äôll be the first to know.‚Äù He added: ‚ÄúBut it is working.‚Äù **SEPTEMBER: ‚ÄòTHE VACCINES DO WORK. ‚Ä¶ IT‚ÄôS TREMENDOUSLY SUCCESSFUL.'** ‚ÄúThe vaccines do work,‚Äù Trump said on a conservative talk-radio show. ‚ÄúAnd they are effective. So here‚Äôs my thing: I think I saved millions and millions of lives around the world.‚Äù He added: ‚ÄúAnd now countries are using our vaccines, and it‚Äôs tremendous. It‚Äôs tremendously successful.‚Äù ""December: Don‚Äôt let the libs win when you promote vaccine skepticism At an event with former Fox News host Bill O‚ÄôReilly in Dallas, Trump disclosed that he got a booster shot after all. He did so despite his August comments about a Big Pharma money-grab and despite having told the Wall Street (truncated)

column30: Federal Judge Blocks New York City‚Äôs School COVID-19 Vaccine Mandate By Zachary Stieber September 25, 2021 Updated: September 25, 2021 New York City‚Äôs COVID-19 vaccine mandate for teachers and other Department of Education staffers is on pause after a federal judge late Friday granted a request to temporarily block it. Plaintiffs, a group of teachers, asked for a temporary injunction pending review by a three-judge panel on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit. U.S. Appeals Court Judge Joseph Bianco, a George W. Bush nominee, in a one-page order granted the request. The panel will now decide whether to impose an injunction pending appeal or allow the mandate to take effect. Rachel Maniscalco and three other New York City Department of Education workers sued over the mandate, which was supposed to start on Sept. 27. They said the order, which requires all workers to show proof they‚Äôve received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine, is government overreach, violating the U.S. Constitution‚Äôs Due Process Clause. That clause states in part that no state can ‚Äúdeprive any person of life, liberty, or property, without due process of law.‚Äù The right to pursue a profession is a liberty interest and the mandate, which threatens to cost workers who don‚Äôt comply with their jobs, interferes with it, the suit said. U.S. District Judge Brian Cogan, another George W. Bush nominee, earlier this week declined to block the mandate, ruling plaintiffs failed to show they would likely succeed in their suit. That prompted an appeal and led to Bianco‚Äôs ruling. It‚Äôs not clear when the three-judge panel will make their decision. RELATED NYC: Thousands of School Staff Unvaccinated, Unions Want Mandate Deadline Delay In a statement to news outlets, the city‚Äôs Department of Education (DOE) said it was confident the mandate will ultimately be upheld ‚Äúonce all the facts have been presented, because that is the level of protection our students and staff deserve.‚Äù ‚ÄúOur current vax-or-test mandate remains in effect and we‚Äôre seeking speedy resolution by the Circuit Court next week. Over 82 percent of DOE employees have been vaccinated and we continue to urge all employees to get their shot by Sept. 27,‚Äù the agency added. Unions have urged the city to delay or restructure the mandate, asserting it would lead to teacher shortages. Some schools have dozens of unvaccinated staffers, Mark Cannizzaro, president of the Council of School Supervisors and Administrators, a union representing principals in the city, told reporters earlier Friday. Mayor Bill de Blasio, a Democrat, has refused. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been planning all along. We have a lot of substitutes ready, but I think the big story here is going to be that the vast majority, overwhelming majority of teachers and staff are going to come in vaccinated to serve our kids next week,‚Äù he said on a radio show Friday. Zachary Stieber REPORTER Follow Zachary Stieber covers U.S. news, including politics and court cases. He started at The Epoch Times as a New York City metro reporter. zackstieberzackstieber

column1: Liberals vs Conservatives The War Room
column30: We really need to be more vigilant in who we watch, read and share online. People are using flat earth, Covid, election fraud, vaccines and other conspiracies to make a lot of money. They know what they're peddling is truly fake and dangerous but don't care. Sadly, conspiracies spread faster than the verifiable truth. By the time the truth catches up, the damage has been done. ''...conspiracy theories, and the people who promote them, can get a lot of views‚Äîand money. Health misinformation poses its own challenges, and existing conspiracy theories and false claims are adapting and spreading in the current pandemic faster than fact-checking‚Äîor sometimes science‚Äîcan catch up. The spread of hateful misinformation targeting marginalized groups leads to harassment, threats, and violence. Health misinformation can lead people to ignore life-saving public health measures or inspire them to try dangerous ‚Äúcures.‚Äù Anthony Fauci, who along with Bill Gates has become a leading villain for coronavirus conspiracy theorists, has increased his personal security after a swell of death threats. The relationship between fringe and mainstream YouTubers can be symbiotic, according to Alice Marwick, an assistant professor in communication at the University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill. ‚ÄúBoth members of the discussion are trying to benefit,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúThe fringe person from getting this mainstream, and the mainstream from getting a potentially increased audience.‚Äù Anti-vaccine activists, along with other supporters of conspiracy theories, are strongly motivated to seek out bigger and bigger audiences, says Marwick. YouTube and influencer culture has long been vulnerable to their efforts, leading unwitting or unprepared personalities with large followings to host proponents of increasingly extreme views in the name of intellectual debate, curiosity, or controversy. Even when interviewers frame the video as a debate, Marwick says, ‚Äúthey‚Äôre just opening the Overton window to whatever fringe idea is being promoted by the guest.‚Äù The most popular of these additions to Bet-David‚Äôs YouTube channel, ‚ÄúDr Buttar Accuses Fauci, Gates & The Media For Using COVID-19 To Drive Hidden Agenda,‚Äù is a two-hour interview with Rashid Buttar, an anti-vaccine activist with his own small channel who has, among other things, claimed that the coronavirus is a bioweapon. In the video, Buttar asserts to Bet-David that the death count for covid-19 is being artificially inflated, that doctors and nurses speaking to the media are ‚Äúpaid actors,‚Äù that dead bodies seen on TV and in the news are ‚Äúmannequins,‚Äù and that covid-19 is no different from the ‚Äúregular flu.‚Äù He also urges viewers to ‚Äúgo out and demonstrate‚Äù that the pandemic is a hoax. These statements appear to be against YouTube‚Äôs rules, but the benefit for Buttar is clear: according to SocialBlade, a third-party analytics site for influencers, he had 4,200 subscribers on March 28. He just passed 250,000. In fact, many claims by conspiracy theorists are already discredited, DiResta notes. Anti-vaccine videos are ‚Äúa mix of jargony pseudoscience woo that's often already been debunked and huge big numbers designed to scare people, taken entirely out of context,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúAudiences who aren't immersed in the facts, and are unfamiliar with anti-vaccine rhetorical games, think they're hearing something scandalous. And then they go on to tell their friends about it, or occasionally begin to follow the anti-vax influencer. ‚Äú I asked Bet-David whether he felt any responsibility over airing these views on his channel‚Äîparticularly potentially harmful claims by his guests, urging viewers to ignore public health recommendations. ‚ÄúI do not,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI am responsible for what comes out of my mouth. I‚Äôm not responsible for what comes out of your mouth‚Äù For him, that lack of responsibility extends to misinformation that could be harmful to his audience. He is just giving people what they are asking for. That, in turn, drives attention, which allows him to make money from ads, merchandise, speaking gigs, and workshops. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs up to the audience to make the decision for themselves,‚Äù he says. Besides, he thinks he‚Äôs done interviewing anti-vaccine activists for now. He‚Äôs trying to book some ‚Äúbig name‚Äù interviews of what he termed ‚Äúpro-vaccine‚Äù experts. But the anti-vaccine activists might not need access to Bet-David's channel any longer, anyway. Earlier this week, Mikovits claimed that she ""got word"" President Trump watched an interview she did with another YouTube channel. That video, which is still on available to watch, has more than 600,000 views."" https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/05/07/1001252/youtube-covid-conspiracy-theories/?fbclid=IwAR12KB555XBvMIrSii2V6wo25Up5P0eNXThscL-aa7gpx5qby90hdsS4TNI

column30: Rep. Chip Roy (R-TX) on Monday blasted Democrats who want to police private text messages, following a report that Biden allies want to use SMS carriers to dispel misinformation about the COVID-19 vaccine. Roy appeared on ‚ÄúTucker Carlson Tonight‚Äù in part to address a Monday report from Politico that claimed the Biden administration is ‚Äúcasting conservative opponents of its Covid-19 vaccine campaign as dangerous and extreme‚Äù and plans to work with SMS carriers to suppress anti-vaccine sentiment even in private texts. As Carlson said, per Fox News: On Monday, Politico reported plans from the Biden administration to battle misinformation in regards to the COVID-19 vaccine. ‚ÄúThe White House has decided to hit back harder on misinformation and scare tactics after Republican lawmakers and conservative activists pledged to fight the administration‚Äôs stated plans to go ‚Äòdoor-to-door‚Äô to increase vaccination rates,‚Äù Politico wrote. ‚ÄúThe pushback will include directly calling out social media platforms and conservative news shows that promote such tactics.‚Äù The article continues how pro-Biden groups and the Democratic National Committee will work with SMS carriers to ‚Äúdispel misinformation‚Äù in peoples‚Äô private text messages. ‚ÄúBiden allied groups, including the Democratic National Committee, are also planning to engage fact-checkers more aggressively and work with SMS carriers to dispel misinformation about vaccines that is sent over social media and text messages,‚Äù Politico reports. Describing the DNC‚Äôs alleged tactics to interfere with private text messages as ‚Äúpatently absurd,‚Äù Roy said, ‚ÄúThis whole issue of the vaccine hits very close to home for me. My father, in 1949 when he was seven years old, he was diagnosed with polio. And my grandmother was nursing my grandfather, who was sick with cancer ‚Äî he died that fall ‚Äî and then raised my dad as a single mom, nursed him to health. And he lived his whole life ravaged by it. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm grateful to have a vaccine for me, vaccines for my sons and my daughter,‚Äù Roy continued. ‚ÄúI believe in vaccines, and I‚Äôll be damned if I‚Äôm going to allow Democrats ‚Ä¶ come in and start calling you an anti-vax quack or call me an anti-vaxxer because I dare to believe that it is our duty as Americans, our patriotic duty, to make decisions for ourselves, not have Democrats looking at our text messages, not having them try to shame the American people into taking a vaccine.‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is the danger we face as Americans, the forgotten men and women out here who are getting rolled over by the power of government, but also the oligopoly, these corporate cronies who are trying to use all of this to fatten their own wallets,‚Äù Roy added. Roy spoke out last week against the Biden administration for aggressively pushing COVID-19 vaccines, prompting a White House official to reportedly scoff at his concerns. As The Daily Wire reported: A White House official reportedly dismissed concerns Rep. Chip Roy (R-TX) made this week regarding the Biden administration‚Äôs recent move to go door-to-door pushing the COVID-19 vaccine. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just sick and God-darn tired of the Left, and this government, dictating to me, frankly, anything at all,‚Äù Roy told RealClearPolitics White House reporter Philip Wegmann in an interview. ‚ÄúBack the F off. That‚Äôs my message to the White House.‚Äù When Wegmann reached out to a White House official to ask if they had a response to Roy, the official texted, ‚Äúlol no.‚Äù

column34: Druthers News & Information
column35:
Nichola‚Äôs Story | Oct. 28 | ‚ÄúSo this is me yesterday at Alfred hospital after 8 days of feeling really crappy and having given in to the pressure of getting vaccinated. 

This is me having  an ecg on my heart, and waiting for a chest X-ray and Bloods to be taken and possible further screening of my lungs incase of possible bloodclots. 

I was vaccinated on a Monday and instantly felt awful. To say I felt drained is an understatement. By the Thursday and Friday my chest felt as though someone was sitting on it and I couldn‚Äôt even run in small stints with the dog, Friday night I had crushing pain in my chest and my left arm went numb. I decided to ride the pain out as I didn‚Äôt want to ‚Äúburden the healthcare system‚Äù but by Saturday and Sunday I was having stabbing pains in the centre of my chest every 2 minutes for hours. My back felt terrible too, right where my lungs sit and monday morning I woke up to stabbing, throbbing pains in my heart.

I finally decided to go to the hospital and whilst I sat there after I‚Äôd been triaged 10 people came in in the space of around 20 minutes and EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM had the exact same symptoms as me and all  had had doses of Pfizer. I could hear each conversation crystal clear so I‚Äôm just relaying what I heard. One guy had been in two weeks ago after his first jab and had been referred to a cardiologist and was back again with the same pains in his chest he was 20! 

Now let be clear, this is a vaccine I did not want. But having spent a massive chunk of my life savings just living during these 260 days of lockdown and being told I wouldn‚Äôt be able to work, be a part of society and just live without being bullied, segregated and discriminated against I caved. Now As I‚Äôm writing this I have stabbing pains in my heart and left side of my boob as well as the centre of my chest. I‚Äôm shaking with heart palpitations and feel exhausted. The doctor told me that I had had a reaction to the vaccine and many people have come in with the exact same symptoms as mine having had Pfizer but 98-99% were usually ok and that a lot of side effects are coming out as it is a ‚Äúnew vaccine in the very early stages‚Äù. I was sent home after extensive testing and told to rest and take Panadol. Today the pain has moved to the left side of my boob and mainly around my heart. I went for a walk in the fresh air today and felt totally drained after. Life right now is really quite difficult and I am quite scared! 

So in the space of 8 days I went from being super fit and healthy, non smoker, non drinker extremely active to daily heart and lung pain which ranges from crushing pain to stabbing, and the most extreme fatigue I‚Äôve ever felt because I went against everything I believe in to stop people in society shunning and judging me.

Please think again before you attack someone‚Äôs choices. If someone has vaccine hesitancy then don‚Äôt berate them. The risks of vaccine Injury are real and the numbers of adverse reactions are probably way higher than we know. All because you were ok after your jabs, doesn‚Äôt mean others will be! Let‚Äôs hope I feel better soon. But nobody can tell me that because there is not one shred of data to say how this ends for me!‚Äù

‚Äî‚Äî-

This is just one of an overwhelming amount of stories we hear just like this. Maybe it‚Äôs time to start questioning things more deeply! Like, why are the vax manufacturers relieved of all liability when their products cause injury or death?

column30: May 26, 2021, 9:25 AM EDT Ohio will announce its first $1 million winner Wednesday for the state‚Äôs highly anticipated Vax-a-Million lottery, an initiative to push people to get their Covid-19 inoculations. The winner, one of 2,758,470 adult entries in the drawing, will be the first of five residents who are expected to be randomly selected for the cash prize, according to the state. In addition to the $1 million drawing, one of 104,386 residents between 12 and 17 years old will win a college scholarship. Ohio is offering five teenagers full-ride scholarships to any of its state colleges and universities, providing full tuition, room and board for four years. Winners will be revealed each Wednesday through June 23 at 7:29 p.m. Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine publicly announced the Vax-a-Million program two weeks ago, telling residents that those who were vaccinated will be automatically entered for the lottery, paid for by federal coronavirus funds. DeWine acknowledged that some people might consider the idea ‚Äúcrazy‚Äù and a ‚Äúwaste of money‚Äù but the state saw a surge in vaccine sign-ups almost immediately following the announcement. Appointments for shots spiked two days after, with more than 25,400 doses administered on May 14.

Our purpose is to protest these three areas: 1) Governor Michelle Lujan Grisham Name Calling Voters QAnon Lizard People, 2) NMLA $10 M Vax2MaxSweepstakes for vaccinated people only, and 3) most important is the focus of NMDOH vaccination efforts on New Mexican Children to get 80% documented compliance. Issue one: On June 3, during her campaign speech, Governor Grisham publicly mocked and name called people who disagreed her policies by calling them QAnon Lizard People. Recognizing her reactionary response during her campaign speech to belittle her constituents, WE EMBRACED THE NAME. Further, Lujan Grisham has neglected her opportunity as our highest elected to be a fair and honorable leader and apologize in an interview for her insult to people who disagree with her policies and her decision to run for re-election. Issue two: Vax 2 the Max Sweepstakes, is a state run lottery that awarded $1 on June 18, with 5 more lotteries scheduled in July and August. Our complaint is that NMDOH Equity Plan and the New Mexico Lottery Association NMLA is using Cares Act Federal Funds to incentivize the jab and discriminates against non-vaccinated from participating. Our protestation is that the money should be spent on restarting our economy by helping businesses and creating education-help programs for our children. Documenting medical information violates HIPAA. $10 million dollars will be awarded to only 21 people. We disagree with the legality and equity of this decision for New Mexicans. Issue three: In God‚Äôs eyes, OUR CHILDREN are a blessing to be protected and raised with great care and consideration for lives, health, and education. Our final protestation is to disagree with her public comment from KOB virtual interview on June, 22. Lujan Grisham is quoted as, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going to keep getting vaccinated, (giving) kiddos the opportunity not to wear masks when they‚Äôre competing and move towards that environment in a classroom when you get a baseline of immunity.‚Äù Lujan Grisham answer is she is committed to focus on kids, which means she is looking to push the unapproved inoculation for children despite the Food and Drug Administration not clearing them for use other than in an ‚Äúemergency use authorization‚Äù phase. Also, children are at the lowest risk of contracting the virus. She added that she wants 75% of New Mexicans fully jabbed by August and 80% jabbed with their first shots (Pinon Post, J.Block, 6.22.21) New Mexico ranked lower than all other states on the Chance for Success Index, with a grade of D-plus and a score of 68. That‚Äôs due in part to being at the bottom of the rankings on family income and near the bottom on other indicators, like for the 2015-16 school year high school graduation rates, where it ranked 50th (Education Week, E.Blad , 9.3.19). Grassroots organizing is delighted to assemble at the capitol building and celebrate the removal of fences around our cherished Roundhouse. We are publicly assembling as LiZARD People to stand united against illegal monetary incentives, discrimination, and masking our kids in schools and sport activities. WE have a Constitutional Right to Peacefully Assemble without reprisal by the government. Disclaimer We thank you for coming, you are here to honor your 1st Amendment - The Freedom of Religion, Freedom of Speech and the Freedom to Assemble. You are here of your own FREE WILL and we ask that you be responsible for your actions. We ask you to know your personal space and know your surroundings We want everyone to be safe and enjoy gathering as New Mexicans and Citizens of our great nation, The United States of America.

column35:
# **The Legislature to Vote on VAX MANDATES and PASSPORTS as Early as Monday, August 30.  ‚ÄúYour papers please‚Äù is coming to California unless We the People stop them.**

As always, ‚Äú***the most important political office is that of the private citizen***.‚Äù Justice Louis D. Brandeis

With only days to go in the legislative session, CA Dems ‚Äúgut and amend‚Äù a transportation bill, AB 455, to force all employers and private business to require the proof of taking #CoronaVirus #Covid so called ‚Äúvaccine‚Äù for employee and customers.  

‚ÄúGut and amend‚Äù is a sneaky political tactic to slip controversial laws through at the end of the legislative session without public scrutiny. 

The next day, CA Dems gut and amended another bill, AB 1102, to shield employers from liability if they require employees to take the experimental so called ‚Äúvaccine.‚Äù  See links to the California Globe articles at the end of this post for more information.

******************************
# **WHAT WE CAN DO.**

‚ÄúThe most important political office is that of the private citizen.‚Äù Justice Louis D. Brandeis

**1.  Email or call your state senator and assembly member. **

Someone set up One Click Politics for this issue.

https://oneclickpolitics.global.ssl.fastly.net/messages/edit?promo_id=13881&utm_source=Godspeak+Calvary+Chapel&utm_campaign=ecb30764c7-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2018_03_27_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_3632513132-ecb30764c7-236602457

Go to this website, enter your info, press ‚Äúcall,‚Äù their system calls you and then connects you to your state senator and assembly member.   They give you a sample script, but say what you want.  It does not have to be long.  

I tried it, and it works.  It is clear and easy to use.  On Sunday, I left a voice mail for my state senator, and my assembly member‚Äôs voice mail box was full so I will try again on Monday. 

The phones will hopefully be very busy, and they may even take their phones off the hook, but keep trying.

We can also them through their websites.  I emailed my assembly member, James Ramos, through his website. https://lcmspubcontact.lc.ca.gov/PublicLCMS/ContactPopup.php?district=AD40

We can also visit their offices.   

**2.  Be respectful but firm. **

**3.  Share this message with everyone you can, as soon as you can. **

We need to burn the phone lines starting immediately, if not sooner. 

******************************

Here are the California Globe articles regarding AB 455 and 1102:

--https://californiaglobe.com/section-2/california-legislature-guts-transportation-bill-to-create-vaccine-mandate-on-private-industry/

--https://californiaglobe.com/section-2/another-gutted-bill-amended-to-compel-ca-employers-to-require-covid-vaccine-as-condition-of-employment/

column35:
California has a serious election integrity problem.  10's of thousands more people are registered to vote, than the actual number of eligible adults in the state.  That's a massive systemic election fraud problem & it has to be fixed.  

Thousands of illegal immigrants have been sent voter registration forms with their CA Driver License renewals.  Does Newsom or the Secretary of State know how many people who aren't here legally, are registered to vote and actively participate in our elections?  The answer is Gavin doesn't know, but he's fine with any level of election fraud that he and other Leftists believe will help them stay in power.  

The fraud has to stop, but I can't stop it alone.  I need your support to become CA's next governor, so we can work together, pressure the CA Secretary of State and pressure local county election officials to audit their voter rolls and remove anyone who's not an eligible U.S. Citizen.  

We also need to pressure the Legislature to finally pass a Voter I.D. law.  How complicated is this idea?  You already need a Driver License or CA I.D. card to get on an airplane, buy alcohol, buy a bus pass and many other daily activities in life.  What kind of politician would object to ensuring the integrity of such a fundamental part of our Constitutional Republic, like 'free and fair elections'?  

Are you fed up with the fraud and the lies and the deceit in Sacramento?  Volunteer, donate, and join my team to help me Reform California and Restore Transparent Election Integrity!

column30: ""Canada is our largest trading partner, so any disruption at the border will certainly have consequences for the U.S. economy whether it is the auto sector, manufacturing, agricultural products or consumer goods,"" the American Trucking Associations said. As a COVID-19 vaccine mandate for non-U.S. individuals seeking to enter the country by land or sea takes effect Saturday, critics in the trucking industry and Congress are warning the measure will only exacerbate U.S. supply chain problems and inflation ‚Äî possibly affecting food supplies. Under the newly effective Department of Homeland Security rules, originally announced in October, essential foreign travelers entering the country ""via land ports of entry or ferry terminals along our Northern and Southern borders"" must now be fully vaccinated. During the pandemic, truck drivers were allowed to travel across U.S. land borders under an exemption from entry restrictions for essential foreign travelers, but truckers are subject to the new mandate.

column34: This is a re-share of a post
column35:
‚ÄúSeveral people come in to get vaccinated who have tried to sort of disguise their appearance and even went so far as to say, ‚ÄòPlease, please, please don‚Äôt let anybody know that I got this vaccine.‚Äô‚Äù Although they want to protect themselves from the coronavirus and its variants, these patients are desperate to ensure that their vaccine-skeptical friends and family never find out what they have done.

Missouri is suffering one of the worst COVID-19 surges in the country. Some hospitals are rapidly running out of ICU beds. To Americans who rushed to get vaccinated at the earliest opportunity, some Missourians‚Äô desire for secrecy is difficult to understand. It‚Äôs also difficult to square with the common narrative that vaccine refusal, at least in conservative areas of the country, is driven by a lack of respect or empathy from liberals along the coasts. ‚ÄúProponents of the vaccine are unwilling or unable to understand the thinking of vaccine skeptics‚Äîor even admit that skeptics may be thinking at all,‚Äù lamented a recent article in the conservative National Review. Writers across the political spectrum have urged deference and sympathy toward holdouts‚Äô concerns about vaccine side effects and the botched CDC messaging about masking and airborne transmission early in the pandemic. But these takes can‚Äôt explain why holdouts who receive respect, empathy, and information directly from reliable sources remain unmoved‚Äîor why some people are afraid to tell their loved ones about being vaccinated.

Derek Thompson: Millions are saying no the vaccines. What are they thinking?

What is going on here? Sociology suggests that pundits and policy makers have been looking at vaccine refusal all wrong: It‚Äôs not an individual problem, but a social one. That‚Äôs why individual information outreach and individual incentives‚Äîsuch as Ohio‚Äôs Vax-a-Million program, intended to increase vaccine uptake with cash prizes and college scholarships‚Äîhaven‚Äôt worked. Pandemics, by definition, are collective problems. They propagate and kill because people live in communities. As a result, addressing pandemics requires understanding interpersonal dynamics‚Äînot just what promotes trust among people, but which behaviors convey status or lead to ostracism.

RECOMMENDED READING
Photo collage of Elnathan John
‚ÄòWhen My Satire Becomes Popular, I Must Ask, What Is the Problem?‚Äô
CONOR FRIEDERSDORF
Illustration of an apple covered in ""I got my COVID-19 vaccine"" stickers
The 1 Thing Teachers Can Do to Protect Students
KATIE MOYLAN AND DAVID SCHEPARD
Bandoliers rest on sandbags in the foreground, overlooking a rocky valley.
Liberal Democracy Is Worth a Fight
ANNE APPLEBAUM
Shifting from an individual to a relational perspective helps us understand why people are seeking vaccination in disguise. They want to save face within the very specific set of social ties that sociologists call ‚Äúreference groups‚Äù‚Äîthe neighborhoods, churches, workplaces, and friendship networks that help people obtain the income, information, companionship, mutual aid, and other resources they need to live. The price of access to those resources is conformity to group norms. That‚Äôs why nobody strives for the good opinion of everyone; most people primarily seek the approval of people in their own reference groups.

In Missouri and other red states, vaccine refusal on partisan grounds has become a defining marker of community affiliation. Acceptance within some circles is contingent on refusal to cooperate with the Biden administration‚Äôs public-health campaign. Getting vaccinated is a betrayal of that group norm, and those who get the shot can legitimately fear losing their job or incurring the wrath of their families and other reference groups.

Sociology solves mysteries like these by zeroing in on problematic relationships, not the decisions that individuals make in isolation. Many of the people refusing safe, effective vaccination amid a deadly pandemic are enmeshed in a very distinctive type of relationship that sociologists have been studying for more than 70 years: the con job. Con artists gain social or financial advantage by convincing their marks to believe highly dubious claims‚Äîand to block out all information to the contrary.

COVID-19-related cons have become big business, not just for right-wing media outlets that have gained viewers while purveying vaccine disinformation but also for small-time social-media grifters and enterprising professionals. The New York Times recently profiled Joseph Mercola, a Florida osteopath whom the paper described as ‚ÄúThe Most Influential Spreader of Coronavirus Misinformation.‚Äù Four years ago, the Federal Trade Commission forced Mercola to pay nearly $3 million in settlements for false advertising claims about indoor tanning beds that he had sold. In February of this year, Mercola told his millions of followers on Facebook that the vaccine would ‚Äúalter your genetic coding,‚Äù and promoted his line of vitamin supplements as an alternative (truncated)

column30: Everything you ever wanted to know about the CDC/Harvard/Wuhan lab connection. Long, but I guarantee you'll find something new or something you forgot about. 2015 was a very big year for this kind of thing. BTW, Obama left on Jan 20, 2017 and the Ebola debacle happened in 2014-2015. So far there is no evidence proving that Dr Charles Lieber, a Harvard professor, created the (current) coronavirus. However, here are some facts that suggest it is highly likely he was ""involved"" in some way. The links I post today will support most if not all of the facts below. The idea that Lieber was using US grant money to do research for China, is outrageous. These research grants need to be more closely monitored and audited. The List 1. The shipping of and storing of hazardous pathogens is haphazard. 2. There is a conflict of interest, if not a breach of security when a scientist working on DARPA also works with China. 3. The biosafety level 4 (BSL-4) lab in Wuhan is the only such lab in all of China. Conceived in 2003 and completed in 2015. However, Corona-virus related projects were in process years before it's official completion date. 4. ""Dr. George Church, Professor of Genetics at Harvard Medical School and Professor of Health Sciences and Technology at Harvard and MIT"" is a colleague of Dr. Lieber. 5. Dr. Church received funding from the late Jeffrey Epstein and ""a lot of George Church‚Äôs recent research also involves the study and engineering of viruses. Most recently in his career, Dr. Church has been funded by DARPA and IARPA, with the most recently funded grant titled, ‚ÄòFunctional Genomic and Computational Assessment of Threats‚Äô (by IARPA)."" 6. Xing-Yi Ge works at (WUT) and presumably the BSL-4 lab in Wuhan, and worked on SARS-like virus That was ""circulating in Chinese horseshoe bat populations"" in 2015. At the time, he was also working with researchers at Harvard. 7. Lieber lied about working with several Chinese organizations including the Wuhan University of Technology (WUT) ""He was being paid $50,000 per month by the Chinese university and given $1.5 million to establish a nanoscience research lab at WUT"" 8. Also indicted was a Chinese spy posing as a student and a ""cancer researcher"" who tried to smuggle 21 vials of biological material out of the US to China. 9. Many of the projects funded by government grants are not monitored. In some cases they get large amounts of money to do redundant (unnecessary), or bogus, mostly worthless studies. (IMHO) 10. There's a CDC, Netherlands, Saudi, Novel Corona virus connection. 11. In 2012, a ""novel coronavirus"" put scientists on alert. Ok, that's a lot of ""circumstantial evidence"". Now, a bunch of links to consider... some of the links are from as far back as 2007, but I think they are all relevant. I made titles/comments for some of the links. (2009) Anti-vax heresy from highly respected doctors (a must read). ""Yet now some flu experts are challenging the medical orthodoxy and arguing that for those most in need of protection, flu shots and antiviral drugs may provide little to none. So where does that leave us if a bad pandemic strikes?"" https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2009/11/does-the-vaccine-matter/307723/ This is very interesting: ""A"" coronavirus was (first) discovered in Saudi Arabia in 2012! ""The virus subsequently caused small but deadly outbreaks in at least three countries in the Middle East and sparked international concern."" https://www.nature.com/news/tensions-linger-over-discovery-of-coronavirus-1.12108 This was published in 2011, before the Saudi Arabia story. There is a Fouchier (below) connection to the Saudi corona virus. https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/27/science/debate-persists-on-deadly-flu-made-airborne.html ""Novel Virus"" (2012) ""Clusters of coronavirus cases put scientists on alert"" ""Surveillance ramped up after novel virus is identified in three Middle Eastern countries."" https://www.nature.com/news/clusters-of-coronavirus-cases-put-scientists-on-alert-1.1 2006 Don't forget, members of the CDC have patents for viruses ""Indonesia, the country with the most H5N1 cases and deaths, stopped sending H5N1 isolates to the WHO last December to protest the cost of commercial vaccines derived from the viruses. "" http://www.cidrap.umn.edu/news-perspective/2007/08/who-indonesias-withholding-viruses-endangers-world Xing-Yi Ge's study page https://www.semanticscholar.org/author/Xing-Yi-Ge/5583604?sort=influence (2011-Swine Flu) ""Fear and confusion"" keep in mind this is the 2nd version of the vaccine, the first one caused Guillain-Barre syndrome. https://www.nytimes.com/2009/10/10/health/10primer.html About the first Swine Flu vaccine: ""The real victims of this pandemic were likely the 450-odd people who came down with Guillain-Barre syndrome, a rare neurological disorder, after getting the 1976 flu shot.
